Reviews.Title: “Out of the way hotel”
Reviews.Author: richJay
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is clean well maintained and hospitable then you don't need to look much further little gripes about the parking as none can be reserved for the stay also breakfast could do with a little tweak but all in all in a busy place we weren't able to ask for much else for the price so a lovely establishment with anything that a low cost place can ask

Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel wuth a bit of commuting.”
Reviews.Author: biribilis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our London visit and we found out that the hotel is a bit out of the center, however it is not that far if you are not on a tight schedule. The rooms were very clean to the point that they were almost spotless. The hotels breakfast is not something to be considered. The two closest subway stations are about 7 to 15 minutes by foot but threre is a bus stop almost outside of the hotel. I would recommend taking the bus so that you can see more of the area and not spend your time in the outdated and dirty london subway.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was OK”
Reviews.Author: Markocg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 days. Was OK, but poor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Really quite acceptable if you're not expecting much”
Reviews.Author: harryzac
Reviews.Content: It's an unlikely location...above a Chinese restaurant, but actually the rooms are clean, it's not noisy, the bathroom albeit minute, is adequate and clean with a good powerful hot shower. The staff are pleasant and if you have to go to Acton for any reason like me, for a knock down price on late rooms or the like, it's worth it. The breakfast is not cooked...which considering it's a restaurant is a little odd. However, there's ham and cheese and loads of toast and cereal...more than enough to keep you going for the day. The big bonus is free parking outside. I'd stay there again but not if my London visit needed to be more central.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SianWichmann
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for the money. Easy access into London, lovely rooms, friendly service and breakfast included in the price. I dont think you can get as nice a room and service for the very low cost anywhere else in London.

Reviews.Title: “Overall an acceptable experience”
Reviews.Author: FranceSally
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while on a business trip to London.I chose it because it is close to my son's house. The building has been recently updated but the restaurant seems to be permanently closed despite the sign suggesting it is merely a temporary closure. I booked a "luxury" room, which was fine , but not luxurious, quite large with huge TV & decent bathroom. It was located on the 2nd floor at the end of a corridor where extra beds & bedding were stored, just outside the door. Frankly, the room was ok but the noise was not - there was a party outside in the garden of the pub opposite until around 1.00 am, very heavy traffic noise & the bin collection at 6.00 am (Thursdays) which sounded like an earthquake. To be fair, when I asked to change the room, the staff were very pleasant & offered me the only other available option, the room directly below, which I accepted as the confiuration was different. In fact it proved to better all round. Breakfast is basic, but for me that's fine. The bus stop for Hammersmith is just outside the door & it is a 10 minute walk to Acton Central station. For the price it is a reasonable choice, but do try to get one of the rooms away from the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and clean”
Reviews.Author: mandygilhooly
Reviews.Content: I was a single female traveller staying 5 weeks at this hotel .The staff were very friendly and helpful.My room was cleaned on a daily basis and nothing was too much trouble. .Being female and booking alone I felt safe and secure .I would stay here again if working in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Will return !”
Reviews.Author: Marge028
Reviews.Content: Before leaving I read lots of bad reviews so I was a little scared but it was very good! The room was clean, the beds & bathroom too. The mini fridge was working & CLEAN so we were able to store our food in it, same for the coffee/tea set. True the hotel is away from the centre but there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel & you can't hop off at the wrong stop for it is the last of the line. Taking bus 70 you're 10 minutes away from the underground AND if you take a 7-day travelcard, it works on both the bus & the underground!! Money saver I have to say. Even though there is a pub as well right accross the street I did not heard much noise in the streets at night. The neighbourhood is quiet & there is a supermarket behind the hotel (plus lots of little restaurants in the adjacent streets) so if you don't want to spend lots of money on food you can buy sandwitches & salads & store them in your fridge ;) The breakfast was enough for me (tea/coffe, apple/orange juice, bread, butter, cheese, ham, jams, fruits & croissants) & the staff was very friendly, always asking how we spent our day & ready to help us find our way in the bus/underground. The only things I'm complaining about: the restaurant was closed when we stayed there & one day when we came back we had no hot water & no heater because they had a workup done on the boiler. But all in all our stay went well.

Reviews.Title: “top star stay”
Reviews.Author: 1946Clark
Reviews.Content: Very good value.The room was first class clean and tidy as was shower room. Staff were friendly and helpful. With continental breakfast included in the price of our stay you wont get better in London

Reviews.Title: “OK if you have a car or need to stay in this area.”
Reviews.Author: Frunky
Reviews.Content: The good: - The price is amazing for London - The front desk is friendly and efficient - The room is clean - Internet is free. The connection is fast. - The area is appears to be safe The so-so: - Basic continental breakfast, better than no breakfast at all - but will not hit the spot. No drip coffee, hot water and instant coffee are available. The not-so-good: - It is a 15 minutes walk from the tube (Acton Town) and uphill – You will remember every minute if you carry a heavy suitcase. There are mini-cabs available from the tube for 5 GBP. - It is a 30 minutes subway ride to Heathrow airport – A little long - It is another 30-45 minutes to go to downtown (tip: take the Picadilly line rather than the District line - Picadilly has more trains, less stops and less disruptions) - It is quite noisy with the traffic. I requested another room in the quietest part of the hotel. I could still hear some noise but it was bearable. - Although the room is clean, the carpet is dirty. In the former room, I was greeted with a heavy smell of smoke. Previous guests did not seem to be considerate in leaving the place in good standing. - There is very little partition between the rooms. One night, I could hear my neighbors talking past Midnight and one Sunday at 7 am, I was awaken by someone knocking at a neighbor’s door. When I went out to look, it happened that the knocking came from the far end of the floor! - The neighborhood has very little to offer about London. Unless you have a specific reason to stay there, there are much more interesting neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ~ clean ~ friendly ~ a little bit remote ~ good price for value”
Reviews.Author: Kissamakea
Reviews.Content: My sister, best friend and I stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and were pleasantly surprised. ++cheap (breakfast inclusive) + friendly staff ++ good breakfast with a satisfactory diversity to choose from ++ room & bathroom were cleaned every day + room size was satisfactory (especially for british standard!) ++ clean and nice bathroom + refrigerator, water boiler, TV and additional heating in room ++ elevator and a ramp (at the entrance) for wheelchair user and/or people with a lot of luggage + supermarket next to the hotel (Morrisons) + quiet area - - from the outside it looked a little shabby - decoration of the room is rather tawdry (but that's a matter of taste, I would say) - - !!rather remote!! 15 min WALK to the next underground station >> Acton Town or Ealing Common (Piccadilly and District line) 4-5 min BUS ride to Ealing Common (Piccadilly and District line) OR 8 min BUS ride to Ealing Broadway (CENTRAL and District line) AND THEN additional 20 to 25 min to 'Central London' (Victoria Station or Oxford Circus) General remark: The hotel is quite small, so I imagine, that it could get very crowded in the breakfast room, if there were more guests. Luckily in our case, there were only 4 to 6 other guests - it's March after all =). Remark concering the photos: I know the room looks messy - we were packing at the time =P

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: BucharestDan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights here. We made the reservations online. The room was pretty small but I doubt you can find a bigger one at this price. Clean sheets, room cleaned every day, TV with 4-5 channels, refrigerator, coffee / tea maker. Not noisy during the night, we slept very well. Free and flawless internet access but not wireless. If you don't have a cable, they provide it from the reception. You can buy it for 2 pounds or 5 if you want a longer one because the socket is near the bed, not the bureau / table. Bus stations just steps away, 10 minutes walk to the subway. Plenty of food at breakfast - swedish buffet. Good chinese food at the restaurant at reasonable prices. No smoking in the hotel, I had to get out and smoke in the street. They might have airport transfer, better to check before landing, it could be cheaper than the 50 pounds we payed for a cab from Heathrow to here. The staff was very nice and friendly, we felt great. Anyway, nice place, good value for money, we would check in again here.

HotelInfo.Name: Blue Star Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 51 - 53 Steyne Road | Acton, London W3 9NU, England
